etymology.description: semantic: 扌(手) (shǒu, "hand") + phonetic: 佥(僉) (qiān)
etymology.interpretation: The character 拑 combines the semantic component 扌(手) (shǒu, "hand"), indicating an action done by hand, with the phonetic component 佥(僉) (qiān), suggesting a similar pronunciation. This depicts the action of pinching or clamping something with hands.

examples.chinese: 他拑了我的手(他拑了我的手)，让我感到意外(讓我感到意外)。
examples.pinyin: Tā qián le wǒ de shǒu, ràng wǒ gǎndào yìwài.
examples.english: He pinched my hand, which surprised me.

examples.chinese: 小朋友拑了拑自己的鼻子(小朋友拑了拑自己的鼻子)。
examples.pinyin: Xiǎopéngyǒu qián le qián zìjǐ de bízi.
examples.english: The child pinched his own nose.
